name: ZAYTUNA COLLEGE
mission: Zaytuna College aims to educate and prepare morally committed professional, intellectual, and spiritual leaders, who are grounded in the Islamic scholar...
programs: BA in Liberal and Islamic Studies
Center for Ethical Living and Learning (ZCELL)
theoryOfChange: By training the mind through the trivium and quadrivium alongside Islamic primary texts, the college produces leaders who can navigate modern society with moral and spiritual grounding.

evaluationSources: Accredited by WASC Senior College and University Commission (WSCUC)

zakatClaimEvidence: According to many scholars, institutions such as Zaytuna College meet the requirements for zakat eligibility. However, we have chosen to limit the zakat funds only to the total cost of education for zakat eligible students and not for any other institutional expenditures. We take this sacred trust very seriously, so if you choose to give a portion of your zakat to Zaytuna College, we will do our utmost, God willing, to ensure its most judicious and shariah compliant use. (Source: https://zaytuna.edu/ways-to-give)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Context dependent profile. Consider cause fit, risk profile, and evidence maturity before deciding.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1)
components.improvement_suggestion: Clarify zakat allocation policy and eligible use categories for donors.
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 29/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, education global cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

all_citations.claim: The organization reports a program expense ratio of 56.0%.
Zaytuna College reported total revenue of $18,359,667 and holds 33.6 months of working capital.
The college offers a Bachelor of Arts in Liberal Arts and Islamic Studies and a Master of Arts in Islamic Texts.
Zaytuna College aims to prepare morally committed professional, intellectual, and spiritual leaders.
The institution maintains formal accreditation status for its academic programs.
The college provides a Summer Arabic Intensive as part of its educational offerings.
Zaytuna College is zakat-eligible and provides various ways for donors to contribute.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Zaytuna College earns a moderate overall score, reflecting its status as a stable academic institution with high data confidence but a balanced impact profile focused on capacity building.
areas_for_improvement: program expense ratio of 56.0% is lower than industry benchmarks for direct service charities
Limited public data regarding specific long-term beneficiary outcomes

dimension_explanations.alignment: The institution shows medium donor fit for those prioritizing global education and Islamic scholarship [3]. Its track record is established through formal accreditation and its status as a zakat-eligible entity for qualifying donations [6][8].
dimension_explanations.impact: The college focuses on capacity building by educating future leaders, though its program expense ratio is 56.0% [1][2]. While it maintains a high data confidence level of 0.75, the direct impact on beneficiaries is measured through educational attainment rather than immediate humanitarian relief [3][7].

baseline_narrative.headline: Zaytuna College serves as a premier institution of higher learning dedicated to grounding students in the Islamic scholarly tradition through a rigorous liberal arts curriculum.
strengths: High fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.11 per $1 raised
Exceptional liquidity with 33.6 months of working capital available
Accredited academic programs including a Summer Arabic Intensive and graduate studies
baseline_narrative.summary: Zaytuna College aims to educate morally committed professional and intellectual leaders through its Bachelor of Arts in Liberal Arts and Islamic Studies and Master of Arts in Islamic Texts [3][4]. The institution maintains a strong financial position with a total revenue of $18,359,667 and is recognized as zakat-eligible for donors [2][8].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Zaytuna College earns a moderate overall score, reflecting its status as a stable academic institution with high data confidence but a balanced impact profile focused on capacity building.

alignment.improvement: Clarify zakat allocation policy and eligible use categories for donors.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust this institution due to its <cite id="3">WASC Accredited</cite> status and its Gold Seal of Transparency from Candid, indicating strong organizational reporting.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility further, the college could publish detailed annual impact reports with specific student outcome metrics.

impact.explanation: The college operates with a <cite id="2">program expense ratio of 56.0%</cite> and focuses on capacity building through higher education.
impact.improvement: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed, and document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Accredited institution but limited public outcome metrics

rich_narrative.headline: Zaytuna College serves as a premier institution of higher learning dedicated to grounding students in the Islamic scholarly tradition through a rigorous liberal arts curriculum.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to invest in the long-term intellectual and spiritual leadership of the American Muslim community through accredited higher education.
donor_motivations: Value Islamic institutional development in the West
Want to support the training of future scholars and leaders
Prefer capacity-building over immediate emergency relief
giving_considerations: Higher education requires significant administrative overhead compared to direct relief
Impact is measured in generational leadership rather than immediate lives saved
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking immediate humanitarian relief, high program expense ratios, or direct poverty alleviation programs.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The institution is WASC accredited, ensuring educational standards, but lacks published cost-per-beneficiary metrics.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Educating morally committed leaders through a rigorous liberal arts and Islamic studies curriculum.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: For educational institutions, tracking graduation rates and alumni leadership roles is critical to proving the long-term value of the capacity-building model.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: The college has substantial working capital but requires ongoing funding for campus expansion and endowments.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished as a <cite id="3">WASC Accredited</cite> Islamic liberal arts college in the US.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Focuses specifically on graduate-level theological education
similar_organizations.name: Bayan Islamic Graduate School

strengths.detail: The college demonstrates exceptional fundraising efficiency, spending only <cite id="1">$0.11 per $1 raised</cite>.
Zaytuna College is <cite id="3">WASC Accredited</cite>, ensuring its academic programs meet rigorous institutional standards.
The institution has shown consistent financial expansion with a <cite id="2">19.7% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: Zaytuna College has established itself as a recognized academic institution, achieving <cite id="3">WASC Accredited</cite> status for its degree programs. The college maintains a strong financial trajectory, evidenced by its <cite id="2">$18,359,667 in total revenue</cite> and a robust <cite id="2">19.7% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite>. Furthermore, its fundraising operations are highly efficient, costing just <cite id="1">$0.11 per $1 raised</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: Zaytuna College, <cite id="2">founded in 2009</cite>, serves as a premier institution of higher learning dedicated to grounding students in the Islamic scholarly tradition. The institution aims to educate and prepare morally committed professional, intellectual, and spiritual leaders through its academic programs, which include a BA in Liberal and Islamic Studies and an MA in Islamic Texts. Financially, the college reported <cite id="2">$18,359,667 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year. The organization operates with a <cite id="2">program expense ratio of 56.0%</cite> and demonstrates strong fundraising efficiency, spending just <cite id="1">$0.11 per $1 raised</cite>. Zaytuna College is <cite id="8">zakat-eligible</cite>, accepting zakat for categories including fuqara, masakin, and fisabilillah. The institution is <cite id="3">WASC Accredited</cite>, providing a recognized standard of academic quality for its students in the United States.
